sub_fields.label: Module ID
sub_fields.name: module_id
sub_fields.instructions: Use a single, or hyphen separated words. Mozilla documentation

sub_fields.label: Module Classes
sub_fields.name: module_classes
sub_fields.instructions: To add multiple classes just separate with comma. e.g. first-class,second-class

sub_fields.label: Desktop
sub_fields.name: animation_desktop
sub_fields.instructions: enables/disables animations on desktop browsers.

sub_fields.label: Delay
sub_fields.name: animation_delay
sub_fields.instructions:
Delay is the time before reveal animations begin. By default, delay will be used for all animations. If reset options is true will never use delay.

The number passed to delay is a measure of time in milliseconds.

sub_fields.label: Distance
sub_fields.name: animation_distance
sub_fields.instructions: Controls how far the module will move when revealed in pixels.

sub_fields.label: Duration
sub_fields.name: animation_duration
sub_fields.instructions:
Controls how long animations take to complete.
Accepted value is a measure of time in milliseconds.

sub_fields.label: Opacity
sub_fields.name: animation_opacity
sub_fields.instructions:
Specifies the opacity the module have prior to being revealed.

The number passed to opacity is a range between 0.0 and 1.0. Values outside that range, though valid, will be clamped to the nearest limit.

sub_fields.label: Origin
sub_fields.name: animation_origin
sub_fields.instructions:
Specifies what direction the module come from when revealed.

Please note that You will need a non-zero value assigned to distance for origin to have any visible impact on the module's animation.

sub_fields.label: Scale
sub_fields.name: animation_scale
sub_fields.instructions: Specifies the size of elements have prior to being revealed.
sub_fields.placeholder: The number passed to scale is a proportion relative to computed size.

sub_fields.label: Image dimension
sub_fields.name: image_dimension
sub_fields.instructions:
Define the image dimension by entering the image width and height seperated by comma
e.g. 100, 100
or any existing image sizes
e.g. thumbnail
